pddl4j.exp
Class DerivedPredicate

java.lang.Object
  pddl4j.exp.AbstractExp
      pddl4j.exp.DerivedPredicate
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Exp
public final class DerivedPredicate
extends AbstractExp

This class implements a derived predicate of the PDDL language.

See Also:

apply

public final Exp apply(Substitution sigma)
Substitutes all occurrences of the variables that occur in this expression and that are mapped in the substitution by its binding expression.

Parameters:
sigma - the substitution.
Returns:
a substituted copy of this expression.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if sigma == null.

standardize

public DerivedPredicate standardize()
Standardizes all occurrences of the variables that occur in this expression. Remember that free variables are existentially quantified.

Returns:
a standardized copy of this expression.
See Also:
Exp.standardize()

standardize

public DerivedPredicate standardize(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> images)
Standardizes all occurrences of the variables that occur in this expression. The map argument is used to store the variable already standardized. Remember that free variables are existentially quantified.

Parameters:
images - the object that maps old variable images to the standardize image.
Returns:
a standardized copy of this expression.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if images == null.
See Also:
Exp.standardize(Map)

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns true if this derived predicate is equal to an other object, i.e., if the object is a not null reference to an instance of the class DerivedPredicate and both derived predicates have the same parameters and expression.
